item.description:
This is a first for the Salem Board Games Meetup...a field trip. New England winters can be pretty boring, so let's mix it up a bit.

The Wenham Museum is comprised of the treasures of childhood and explores how New Englanders have lived, worked, dressed and played from the 17th century to today. They boast a world-famous 19th- and 20th-century doll, toy, and game collection.

They are currently hosting the special exhibit Look What I Got!: 100 Years of Timeless Toys, where kids, parents, and grandparents rediscover the joy of favorite childhood pastimes in a colorful exhibition of classic games and toys from the last 100 years.

I've never been to the museum, but hopefully it will be a lot of fun. Let's plan to meet there at noon. Admission is $7.00.

Free parking at the museum is available including limited handicap parking next to the museum.

For more information, visit: http://www.wenhammuse...

The phone number listed is mine and not that of the museum.

*******************
Marica lives very close to the museum and has so kindly offered to host a luncheon for the group after our tour. She will provide soup, salad, coffee, and soda. Should you want anything sweet, feel free to bring it.

Her address is 34 Crescent Road Hamilton, MA and it is a brown house. She does have dogs, but they will be crated while we are there. Her phone number is 978-239-3392.

Should you only be able to attend the museum portion of the day, please indicate that in your RSVP.

group.name: The Salem Board Games Meetup Group

item.name: The Game Group Takes a Field Trip and Lunch
